Bootstrap and Jackknife Functions

Functions to perform bootstrap and jackknife resampling methods.

jaxknife.bootstrap(data, statistic_func, n_resamples, seed)

Bootstrap.

Parameters:

  • data (array) – Input data with shape (N, …) where N is the number of realizations of the observable.

  • statistic_func (callable) – Function to calculate a statistic on one set of realizations of the observable.

  • n_resamples (int) – Number of times to resample the data.

  • seed (int) – Seed for RNG.

Returns:

The value of the statistic for each resample.

Return type:

jax array

jaxknife.bootstrap_resamples(data, n_resamples, seed)

Generate bootstrap resamples.

Parameters:

  • data (array) – Input data with shape (N, …) where N is the number of realizations of the observable.

  • n_resamples (int) – Number of times to resample the data.

  • seed (int) – Seed for RNG.

Returns:

Resampled data with shape (n_resamples, N, …)

Return type:

jax array

jaxknife.jackknife(data, statistic_func)

Jackknife.

Parameters:

  • data (array) – Input data with shape (N, …) where N is the number of realizations of the observable.

  • statistic_func (callable) – Function to calculate a statistic on one set of realizations of the observable.

Returns:

The value of the statistic for each resample.

Return type:

jax array

jaxknife.jackknife_resamples(data)

Generate jackknife resamples.

Parameters:

data (array) – Input data with shape (N, …) where N is the number of realizations of the observable.

Returns:

Resampled data with shape (N, N, …)

Return type:

jax array
